meanings.sent1: Eating vegetables regularly diminishes the risk of getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The rain diminishes as the storm passes.
meanings.sent3: His enthusiasm for the project diminishes when he realizes how much work it will take.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's encouragement diminishes the students' fear of failure.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset diminishes as the sky darkens.

meanings.definition: To make or become smaller, reduce.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to diminish its workforce to cut costs.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick diminishes the size of the coin in his hand.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the pandemic diminishes the global economy.
meanings.sent5: The artist uses shading to diminish the size of the object in the painting.
